intro: Mariscus humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's mariscus, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to arid and coastal environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences with tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils along coastal areas, where it has developed mechanisms to conserve water. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Mariscus humbertii is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
